user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_digest_auth_get_request_info3:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_DigestAuthInfo *
MHD_digest_auth_get_request_info3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  const struct MHD_RqDAuth *params;
  struct MHD_DigestAuthInfo *info;
  enum MHD_DigestAuthUsernameType uname_type;
  size_t unif_buf_size;
  uint8_t *unif_buf_ptr;
  size_t unif_buf_used;
  enum MHD_GetRqNCResult nc_res;

  params = MHD_get_rq_dauth_params_ (connection);
  if (NULL == params)
    return NULL;

  unif_buf_size = 0;

  uname_type = get_rq_uname_type (params);

  unif_buf_size += get_rq_unames_size (params, uname_type);

  if (NULL != params->opaque.value.str)
    unif_buf_size += params->opaque.value.len + 1;  /* Add one for zero-termination */
  if (NULL != params->realm.value.str)
    unif_buf_size += params->realm.value.len + 1;   /* Add one for zero-termination */
  info = (struct MHD_DigestAuthInfo *)
         MHD_calloc_ (1, (sizeof(struct MHD_DigestAuthInfo)) + unif_buf_size);
  unif_buf_ptr = (uint8_t *) (info + 1);
  unif_buf_used = 0;

  info->algo3 = params->algo3;

  if ( (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_MISSING != uname_type) &&
       (MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_UNAME_TYPE_INVALID != uname_type) )
    unif_buf_used +=
      get_rq_uname (params, uname_type,
                    (struct MHD_DigestAuthUsernameInfo *) info,
                    unif_buf_ptr + unif_buf_used,
                    unif_buf_size - unif_buf_used);
  else
    info->uname_type = uname_type;

  if (NULL != params->opaque.value.str)
  {
    info->opaque = (char *) (unif_buf_ptr + unif_buf_used);
    info->opaque_len = get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z (&params->opaque,
                                                     info->opaque);
    unif_buf_used += info->opaque_len + 1;
  }
  if (NULL != params->realm.value.str)
  {
    info->realm = (char *) (unif_buf_ptr + unif_buf_used);
    info->realm_len = get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z (&params->realm,
                                                    info->realm);
    unif_buf_used += info->realm_len + 1;
  }

  mhd_assert (unif_buf_size >= unif_buf_used);

  info->qop = params->qop;

  if (NULL != params->cnonce.value.str)
    info->cnonce_len = params->cnonce.value.len;
  else
    info->cnonce_len = 0;

  nc_res = get_rq_nc (params, &info->nc);
  if (MHD_GET_RQ_NC_VALID != nc_res)
    info->nc = MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_INVALID_NC_VALUE;

  return info;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No explicit compiler language extensions are present in the provided code fragment. I checked for the usual implementation-specific/extension constructs that are commonly documented as compiler extensions, and none appear in the snippet: 

- No use of GCC/Clang __attribute__ or __attribute__((...)) annotations.
- No use of __builtin_* intrinsics or __asm__/asm inline assembly.
- No use of GNU statement-expressions ({ ... }) or typeof operator.
- No nested functions (functions defined inside other functions).
- No use of non-standard keywords (such as __inline__ instead of inline) or other vendor-specific keywords.
- No use of C++-only constructs (references, new/delete, classes, etc.).
- No use of Microsoft-specific extensions (e.g. __declspec) or other vendor-specific extensions.

The identifiers and macros (for example _MHD_EXTERN, MHD_calloc_, mhd_assert) are not themselves language extensions in this snippet — they are macros whose expansions are not shown here. If any of those macros expand to compiler-specific extensions (attributes, builtins, inline asm, etc.), that would need to be checked in their definitions; but based solely on the code shown, no explicit language extensions are used and therefore there are no suspicious fragments to report.
